page.topic: How to Programmatically Set the Min and Max Value for a Slider Control
page.description: The minimum and maximum value for a two-value Slider Control can be set programmatically at run-time.

discussion.p: The Slider Control provides an interface for viewing and editing a single value or range of values in a UX Component. The minimum and maximum value for a Slider Control can be dynamically modified at run-time. This is done by changing the *[js:min]* and *[js:max]* property for the Slider Control's object.
To edit the *[js:min]* and *[js:max]* value of a Slider Control, you must get the Slider object from the UX Component. This is done by calling the *[js:{dialog.object}.getControl()]* method.

Once you have the Slider object, you can set the Slider's *[js:min]* and *[js:max]* value. After setting the *[js:min]* and *[js:max]* value, you must call the Slider object's *[js:refresh()]* method to update the display of the Slider Control in the UX Component.
